result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Clerk Cheree
Cases 15CF519, 15CF802, 15CF849 called: 10:46am
State appears by ADA C.Minder.  Def appears in person/in custody and with Atty Andrew Morgan.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW

State moves to:
15CF519 - Ct. 1 (Subst Battery/Intend Bodily Harm/Repeater)>>AMEND To Misd Battery/Repeater pursuant to 940.19(1)
15CF519 - Ct. 2 (DC/Repeater)>>D&RI
15CF802>>D&RI entire file
15CF849 - Ct. 2 (Felony BJ/Repeater)>D&RI
15CF849 - Ct. 3 (Battery/Repeater)>>D&RI
15CF849 - Ct. 4 (DC/Repeater)>>D&RI
COURT GRANTS ABOVE

PLEA:
15CF519 - Ct. 1 (Misd Battery/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST
15CF849 - Ct. 1 (Felony BJ/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.

COURT ORDERS: 1 year MCJ on each count, concurrent to each other and concurrent to any other sentence defendant is now serving (huber not at issue as defendant is serving prison sentence), w/credit on both counts of 105 days of time already served; CC; DNA sample and ONE DNA surcharge - DNA surcharge in 15CF519 is remitted.

Adj: 10:55am
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk Cheree
Cases 15CF519, 15CF802 and 15CF849 called: 11:11am
State appears by ADA C.Minder; Defendant appears in person/in custody and with Atty Andrew Morgan

15CF519>>
State notes MIL filed in this case; COURT recesses for parties to discuss which Motions are argued.
BOTR: 11:14am - Atty Morgan states agreement with all parts of MIL filed by State.

COURT grants 1A, 1B, and 2, and makes findings on both subparts
COURT grants remainder of Motions in Limine.
Parties state no further issues will be needed to be decided by COURT before trial.

COURT questions if final offer has been made in writing - State notes it has, and COURT will make inquiry prior to trial.
State notes matter will be one day trial -- COURT questions if defendant has arrangements for civilian clothing, and Atty Morgan states he will proceed with that directive.

Adj: 11:19am
